required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Burden of Disease and Functional Impairment in XLH
clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Longitudinal Burden of Disease and Functional Impairment in X-Linked Hypophosphatemia

brief_summary.textblock: Observational study comprising prospective follow up as well as retrospective chart review in order to evaluate the longitudinal course of the disease in XLH patients with a specific focus on functional impairment, physical performance and complications associated with the disease or respective treatment.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an observational / non-interventional study in order to assess the longitudinal course of XLH including disease related burden of disease and functional impairment. This is accomplished by both prospective follow up of affected patients as well as retrospective chart review. Evaluation conducted as per clincal routine and specifically evaluated as part of this study will include
- baseline documententation / demographic (as obtained from medical records)
- general data on XLH-disease specific medical history
- physical examination results
- functional assessments
- technical assessments
- quality of life / questionnaires
- laboratory evaluations

primary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
primary_outcome.description: To document and assess the natural course of disease, associated symptoms and functional impairment in adult patients with XLH.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Assess and document comorbidities and medical treatment regimens applied in adult patients with XLH

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Assess and document functional deficits and mobility constraints in adult patients with XLH

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Assess laboratory parameters over time in adults with XLH

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Describe frequency and outcome of organ / tissue specific health issues (affecting e.g. skeleton, dental health, muscles and joints) in adults with XLH

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluate safety and tolerability of various treatment regimens commonly applied in XLH patients

secondary_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
secondary_outcome.description: Assess quality of life and respective determining factors in adults patients with XLH

other_outcome.measure: Impact of treatment on physical performance
other_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
other_outcome.description: Evaluate the impact of clinical routine treatment including both medical approaches and physical therapy on physical performance and mobility of adult patients with XLH

other_outcome.time_frame: retrospective and up to 48 months from enrollment
other_outcome.description: Document and assess medical history of adult patients with XLH in order to understand its predictive value on burden of disease in adulthood

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female, aged â‰¥ 18 years, inclusive, at the time of enrollment
- Diagnosis of X-linked Hypophosphatemia confirmed by
- documented PHEX mutation in either the patient, or in a directly related family member
- positive family history of XLH and symptoms of the disease or
- Phosphaturia + elevated serum levels of c-term FGF23 or iFGF23 and symptoms of the disease
- Written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Suspected of confirmed diagnosis of another phosphate wasting disorder

facility.name: Orthopedic Center for Musculoskeletal Research, Orthopedic Department, University of Wuerzburg

patient_data.ipd_description: Individual participant data cannot be shared in order to warrant patients privacy.
